title: Biography
text:
Ibnu Ariyanto is a lecturer and researcher at Universitas Indonesia. Since March 2023, he has worked as a lecturer and researcher at the Master Program of Biomedical Science, Faculty of Medicine, Universitas Indonesia, in Jakarta. (Department of Microbiology, FM UI).

He became interested in infectious immunology studies. He is presently concentrating his study on cellular immunity to viral infections such as HIV and CMV. He is eager to learn more about cellular therapy and future infectious disease treatment options.

He is presently employed with UKK PPM LMK (Lab services) as part of the Microbiology Department. In January 2025, he was named the Person in Charge of the Serology Division while simultaneously expanding Genomic Research and Services within the Molecular and Virology Divisions.


Doctor of Biomedical Science Universitas Indonesia
Master of Biomedical Science Universitas Indonesia
Bachelor Degree of Universitas Gadjah Mada



Department of Clinical Microbiology, Faculty of Medicine, Universitas Indonesia

title: About
text:
Ibnu Ariyanto is a lecturer and researcher at Universitas Indonesia. Since March 2023, he has worked as a lecturer and researcher at the Master Program of Biomedical Science, Faculty of Medicine, Universitas Indonesia, in Jakarta. (Department of Microbiology, FM UI).
He became interested in infectious immunology studies. He is presently concentrating his study on cellular immunity to viral infections such as HIV and CMV. He is eager to learn more about cellular therapy and future infectious disease treatment options.
He is presently employed with UKK PPM LMK (Lab services) as part of the Microbiology Department. In January 2025, he was named as Person in Charge of the Serology Division, while simultaneously expanding Genomic Research and Services within the Molecular and Virology Divisions.


Doctor of Biomedical Science Universitas Indonesia
Master of Biomedical Science Universitas Indonesia
Bachelor Degree of Universitas Gaddjah Mada



Department of Clinical Microbiology, Faculty of Medicine, Universitas Indonesia

title: Research
text:
The project is a collaboration study with Prof. Alex Mc Lellan from the Department of Microbiology and Immunology at Otago University, New Zealand. I have gotten a small grant from DIPI to start the project in the Department of Clinical Microbiology, Faculty of Medicine, Universitas Indonesia. My supervisor from UI is dr. Rina la Distia Nora, Sp.M(K)., PhD & Fithriyah, PhD. We will look for the potential role of CAR-NK in TB infections. (ongoing)



The collaborative research between Universitas Indonesia and Curtin University on Cytomegalovirus co-infection in HIV patients. We have discovered the role of several immune cells linked with clinical outcomes:

CD4 and CD8 T-cells
Natural killer cells
Gamma Delta T cells (ongoing)




The CMV research has been done in HIV patients starting ART, followed by 5 years in the JakCCANDO Study.
Currently working with Biomedical Science UI PhD student Isti Anindya to understand CMV’s role in the cognitive development of Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) children (the principal investigator was Prof. Amin Subandrio). (ongoing)
We have been investigating CMV IL10 and human IL10R SNPs with Curtin/UWA Researcher Shelley Waters. The research also part of the Master Research of Yudha Fariska (master Student of Biomedical Science) (ongoing)



I am co-supervisor of Clara Imaniar (master Student of Biomedical Science). The main supervisor is Prof Yeva Rosana (Dept. Microbiology FMUI). Our main goal is to develop a molecular method to identify live M. lepra from clinical samples. (ongoing)



I am participating in the COINCIDE Project. Working under the Prof. Anis Karuniawati Project, I am collaborating with Soe You Naing - Utrecht University. The project involves microbiology specialist student dr.Lili. (ongoing)



I am working with a Master’s student in biomedical science at the Faculty of Medicine (Raisha Muhayya), Universitas Indonesia. Her work is to develop recombinant SARS-CoV-2 vaccine construction. The vaccine design used a bioinformatic approach to predict the optimal epitope for T-cell response. (end)



Work with a private company to validate qPCR kits (end)

title: Research
text:
Ongoing

CAR-NK Project
Initial development of artificial antigen-presenting cells (aAPC) for Natural killer cell expansion, the acceleration of the first CAR-NK cells in Indonesia The project is a collaboration study with Prof. Alex Mc Lellan from the Department of Microbiology and Immunology at Otago University, New Zealand. I have gotten a small grant from DIPI to start the project in the Department of Clinical Microbiology, Faculty of Medicine, Universitas Indonesia. My supervisor from UI is dr. Rina la Distia Nora, Sp.M(K)., PhD & Fithriyah, PhD. (https://dipi.id/awarded-proposal-dipis-small-research-grant-2024/). (ongoing)


Immunology of HIV Patients
The collaborative research between Universitas Indonesia and Curtin University on Cytomegalovirus co-infection in HIV patients. We have discovered the role of several immune cells linked with clinical outcomes:

CD4 and CD8 T-cells
Natural killer cells
Gamma Delta T cells (ongoing)



Cytomegalovirus
The CMV research has been done in HIV patients starting ART, followed by 5 years in the JakCCANDO Study.
Currently working with Biomedical Science UI PhD student Isti Anindya to understand CMV’s role in the cognitive development of Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD) children (the principal investigator was Prof. Amin Subandrio). (ongoing)
We have been investigating CMV IL10 and human IL10R SNPs with Curtin/UWA Researcher Shelley Waters. The research also part of the Master Research of Yudha Fariska (master Student of Biomedical Science) (ongoing)


Molecular Viability Assay of Mycobacterium lepra
I am co-supervisor of Clara Imaniar (master Student of Biomedical Science). The main supervisor is Prof Yeva Rosana (Dept. Microbiology FMUI). Our main goal is to develop a molecular method to identify live M. lepra from clinical samples. (ongoing)

title: Research
text:
Finished

COINCIDE Project (2024-2025)
I am participating in the COINCIDE Project. Working under the Prof. Anis Karuniawati Project, I am collaborating with Soe You Naing - Utrecht University. The project involves microbiology specialist student dr.Lili. (end on April)


Vaccine Development (2021-2023)
I am working with a Master’s student in biomedical science at the Faculty of Medicine (Raisha Muhayya), Universitas Indonesia. Her work is to develop recombinant SARS-CoV-2 vaccine construction. The vaccine design used a bioinformatic approach to predict the optimal epitope for T-cell response. (end)


Infectious Diseases Molecular Diagnostics Development (2021-2022)
Work with a private company to validate qPCR kits (end)

title: Flow Cytometry Workshop in Bahasa
text:
FlowJo untuk Analisis Imunaktivasi Sel T: Instalasi, Gating, dan Analisis Lanjutan




Peserta mampu menginstal dan mengaktivasi FlowJo secara mandiri.
Peserta memahami antarmuka FlowJo dan fitur dasarnya.
Peserta terampil dalam teknik gating, overlay, analisis batch, dan ekspor data ke Excel untuk analisis imunaktivasi sel T.








Materi:

Unduh FlowJo dari situs resmi (https://www.flowjo.com).

Memilih versi yang sesuai (free trial/berlisensi).

Persyaratan sistem (OS: Windows/macOS, RAM, storage).
Langkah aktivasi online (kunci lisensi atau akun FlowJo).
mendapatkan free-trial key
Troubleshoot instalasi (error umum dan solusi).
Aktivitas:

Demo instalasi oleh instruktur.
Peserta melakukan instalasi dan aktivasi mandiri.






Materi:

Layout workspace FlowJo:

Sample Manager: mengimpor data FCS.
Graphical Editor: visualisasi plot.
Table Editor: statistik populasi sel.

Impor data flow cytometry (format FCS).

Download data FCS file latihan analisis

Navigasi dasar: zoom, pan, adjust axis (lin/log).
Penyimpanan workspace (.wsp).
Aktivitas:

Latihan impor data sampel (misal: data sel T CD3+/CD4+/CD8+).
Eksplorasi fitur dasar antarmuka.






Materi:

Strategi gating manual:

Hierarki gating: debris → single cells → lymphocytes → CD3+ → CD4+/CD8+.
Penggunaan Polygon, Rectangle, dan Ellipse Tool.

Overlay Histogram/Plot:

Membandingkan ekspresi marker (misal: CD69+,IFG gamma, IL-2 sebelum/sesudah aktivasi).
Teknik overlay menggunakan Drag-and-Drop.

Batch Analysis:

Analisis data multi-sampel sekaligus.
Penerapan template gating ke seluruh sampel.

Export Data ke Excel:

Ekstrak statistik (MFI, frekuensi populasi).
Ekspor tabel sebagai .csv atau .xlsx.

Aktivitas:

Studi kasus: Analisis aktivasi sel T (misal: IFN-γ+ setelah stimulasi).
Praktik gating, overlay, dan analisis batch.






Durasi: 1 jam
Materi:

Analisis data imunaktivasi sel T (contoh dataset disediakan).
Interpretasi hasil:

Frekuensi sel T teraktivasi (CD25+/CD69+).
Perbandingan antar kelompok (stimulasi vs kontrol).Aktivitas:



Peserta bekerja mandiri dengan dataset.
Presentasi hasil dan diskusi kelompok.





Aktivitas:

Diskusi masalah umum (misal: gating tidak konsisten, error ekspor data).
Kuis singkat untuk evaluasi pemahaman.
Pembagian sertifikat partisipasi (opsional).






Pemahaman dasar flow cytometry (prinsip scatter plot, fluorokrom).
Familiar dengan marker imunologi sel T.





FlowJo v10.8+ (tersedia versi trial).
Dataset contoh (misal: data FCS sel T teraktivasi).
Microsoft Excel/Google Sheets.





Buku panduan FlowJo (tersedia di situs resmi).
Video tutorial FlowJo Channel di YouTube.







Gambar 1. Tampilan jendela workspace.
Jendela Workspace terorganisir dalam tiga bagian utama (seperti pada gambar di atas):




Tasks mengelompokkan band sejenis bersama, dan muncul sebagai “tab” pada Workspace.

Terdapat Workspace task (ditunjukkan di atas) yang mengelompokkan operasi spesifik seperti:

Menambahkan statistik
Melihat properti sampel
Membuat/memodifikasi grup

Bands mengelompokkan aksi serupa. Contoh:

Band Groups: berisi aksi pembuatan grup, penyalinan gate, dan pengelompokan sampel.






Area ini menampilkan daftar grup dengan informasi:

Jumlah sampel (Size)
Peran grup (Role): kompensasi, kontrol, sampel uji, dll.

Klik dua kali nama grup untuk memodifikasi properti grup.





Menampilkan daftar sampel dan analisis dari grup yang dipilih (contoh: Panel 2.2 di atas).
Kolom default yang ditampilkan:

Statistic (statistik)
#Cells (jumlah sel)

Kolom tambahan bisa ditambahkan untuk menampilkan:

Keyword (metadata)
Protokol pewarnaan
Anotasi

Sampel akan diurutkan berdasarkan:

Keyword “well id” (jika ada)
Preferensi penamaan sampel (jika “well id” tidak ditemukan).









FlowJo menggunakan warna dan simbol untuk merepresentasikan:

Status sampel (terkompensasi vs. tidak, valid vs. tidak valid)
Anotasi internal (file terbuka vs. tertutup)
Detail badge lengkap lihat di sini.






Warna teks digunakan untuk identifikasi grup:

Setiap grup memiliki warna unik
Populasi dalam grup mewarisi karakteristik warna teks grupnya
Pelajari lebih lanjut tentang grup di sini.
